messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, Barb Eaton <homemama@i...>
wrote:
> Well I'm glad you're here. I also noticed you are involved with
> Toastmasters. My ds is interested. We're checking it out next
week. :-) Any
> tips? Things we should look for?
>
>
> Barb E

I know, all his references to Toastmasters make me want to get
involved. I was involved with it through my old employer because they
made it available for free, and it was supposed to help with moving
up in the company (wink wink)

I never realized how hard it was getting up and speaking like that,
and how many times i said um, um.....

Ang

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Lost creativity?/Toastmaster
messages.msgSnippet: I was concerned about all the weird inventions they use in training - lights, bells, applause - but it s a WONDERFUL laboratory for learning a PRACTICAL life
messages.messageBody:
I was concerned about all the weird inventions they use in training - lights, bells, applause - but it's a WONDERFUL laboratory for learning a PRACTICAL life skill - I use the skills every single day!!!

Find a club with a time that works for you. Some clubs are 1 hr, some are 2 hr. I like one hour in morning myself.

Oh, and it's cheap too! Ours is $51 / 6 months Canadian, but only AFTER you join up. You can go as long as you want as a guest. You CAN EVEN refuse to talk as a guest. I did. I was crapping brix!

So, go for it. Next to unschooling, it is the best thing that I've done (for my self).

My (TM) Thots!

Tim T

----- Original Message -----
From: Barb Eaton
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, June 10, 2003 7:42 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Lost creativity?/Toastmaster


Well I'm glad you're here. I also noticed you are involved with
Toastmasters. My ds is interested. We're checking it out next week. :-) Any
tips? Things we should look for?


Barb E
"No one can make you change.
No one can stop you from changing.
No one really knows how you must change.
Not even you.
Not until you start. "

- Dr. David Viscott, Author and Psychologist




:
>
> Can't afford to drive to Hixon. That 30 km from Prince George. BC. Canada.
> :O))
>
> But thanks! That's a pretty nice thing to say!! :O)) Love how being fully
> engaged in this "technique" for life is expanding my self-esteem - and then
> you say this! :O)))))
>
> My (happy) thots!
>
> Tim T
